question: Can uncontrolled blood sugar over a long period of time have an adverse effect on your blood vessels? Can it cause them to perforate or actually disentigrate?  The metformin and glimipiride I take are not bringing my blood sugar down.  I have an ablation scheduled in about 6 wks and I am worried that the diabetes will play havoc with my veins and arteries since they will be catheterized.  Is there any danger of this happening?
title: How does diabetes2 affect your veins and arteries?
